title: 105_hr2889
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Commission for the New National Goal: The Advancement of Global Health Act". The Congress finds that the United States has been a leader in defeating totalitarianism and communism, spreading democracy, and advancing technology and medicine. This has allowed the nation to establish a new goal for the 21st century - the global eradication of disease. The "National Commission for the New National Goal: The Advancement of Global Health" is established to recommend a national strategy for eradicating disease globally by coordinating various health care entities. The Commission for the Advancement of Global Health will consist of 13 members with expertise in medical research and related areas, appointed by various government officials and representatives. The Commission for the Advancement of Global Health will consist of 13 members with expertise in medical research and related areas. Members will be appointed by the Speaker of the House, the President with Senate approval, and individuals representing health services recipients. The Commission for the Advancement of Global Health will consist of 13 members appointed for life by the Speaker of the House, the President with Senate approval, and individuals representing health services recipients. Members serve without pay, require a quorum of 7 for meetings, and the Chairperson and Vice Chairperson are designated by the President. Meetings are held monthly or at the call of a majority of members. The Commission for the Advancement of Global Health consists of 13 members appointed for life by the Speaker of the House and the President with Senate approval. Members serve without pay, require a quorum of 7 for meetings, and the Chairperson and Vice Chairperson are designated by the President. Meetings are held monthly or at the call of a majority of members. The Commission has powers as outlined in Section 6. The Commission for the Advancement of Global Health has the authority to hold hearings, take testimony, and receive evidence as needed. Members and agents can take actions authorized by the Commission. The Commission can obtain necessary information from US departments or agencies and accept gifts or property to aid its purpose. The Commission for the Advancement of Global Health can accept gifts, bequests, or devises of money and property to aid its work. Gifts received will be deposited in the Treasury and can be used upon order of the Chairperson or Commission. The Commission can use the United States mails and request administrative support services from the Administrator of General Services for its responsibilities under this Act. The Commission for the Advancement of Global Health can contract with government and private agencies for services needed to fulfill its responsibilities under this Act, without following certain procurement regulations. The Commission established by this Act can submit interim and final reports to the President and Congress, with the final report due within 12 months. The Commission will terminate 30 days after submitting the final report. The Act will take effect 60 days after enactment, and the Commission is required to comply with budget regulations. SEC. 10. BUDGET ACT COMPLIANCE. Any spending authority authorized by this Act shall be effective only to the extent provided in appropriation Acts.
